creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by the artist with the assistance of Keiko Gallery
description: bulbous red organic form with two leg-like formations ending in two small peaks at end
inscription: Japanese inscription bottom center in black
markings: abstract letter shape in orange pigment at bottom center
medium: Lacquer and hemp cloth on Styrofoam
text: This work and the nearby Acceptable reflect Sasai’s femininity and her experience as a mother. A baby’s appearance was the inspiration for this sculpture.
title: Beloved
